title: Visual transparancy behavior on gazebo6 and default

content.raw:
I was recently trying to merge gazebo6 forward to default and I found some [conflicts in Visual class](#!/osrf/gazebo/compare/gazebo6%0Ddefault#chg-gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc). I tried resolving those conflicts in the [gazebo6_to_default branch](#!/osrf/gazebo/compare/gazebo6_to_default%0Ddefault#chg-gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc), which I think is pretty similar to @iche033 's `derived_transparency` branch from the declined pull request #1987, though I [added and modified a couple expectations in the ChildTransparency portion of Visual_TEST.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/compare/gazebo6_to_default%0Ddefault#chg-gazebo/rendering/Visual_TEST.cc). There is currently one failing expectation in the test, though, at [line 420](#!/osrf/gazebo/compare/gazebo6_to_default%0Ddefault#Lgazebo/rendering/Visual_TEST.ccT420).

It's one of the few places where `SetTransparency` is tested with `cascade=false`, and it's unclear to me what the expected behavior should be.

I discussed this with @chapulina a bit, but I'll step aside so the rendering masters can sort it out.
content.html:
I was recently trying to merge gazebo6 forward to default and I found some conflicts in Visual class. I tried resolving those conflicts in the gazebo6_to_default branch, which I think is pretty similar to @iche033 's derived_transparency branch from the declined pull request #1987, though I added and modified a couple expectations in the ChildTransparency portion of Visual_TEST.cc. There is currently one failing expectation in the test, though, at line 420.

It's one of the few places where SetTransparency is tested with cascade=false, and it's unclear to me what the expected behavior should be.

I discussed this with @chapulina a bit, but I'll step aside so the rendering masters can sort it out.
